SortAlgDemo

Class SortHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • SortAlgDemo.SortHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SortHandler
extends java.lang.Thread
    The SortHandler class is a subclass of the Thread class. Hence the handler itself inherits all the behavior and methods of a generic Thread Object, as a result to implement the "multi-threading" feature for the software itself. Note that this class should possess some public access methods to allow external call (from the SortTimer) such that the SortTimer could access its current state.
    The handler would create an instance of SortAlgorithm Object, in which the type of sorting algorithm to be instantiated depends on user's selection from the GUI (SortVisualizer).

      • sortingAlg

        private int sortingAlg
        A private integer which indicate the selected sorting algorithm.
        0 - Insertion Sort
        1 - Shell Sort
        2 - Quick Sort
        3 - Merge Sort

      • sortingDataNo

        private int sortingDataNo
        A private integer which indicate the selected number of data being sorted.

      • sortingOrder

        private int sortingOrder
        A private integer which indicate the selected initial ordering of data being sorted.
        0 - Increasing Order
        1 - Decreasing Order
        2 - Random Order
        3 - Nearly Sorted

      • sortingSpeed

        private int sortingSpeed
        A private integer which indicate the selected sorting speed.
        0 - Step
        1 - Slow
        2 - Medium
        3 - Fast

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • initData

        private void initData()
        A private method to initialize the values of data being sorted.

      • initSort

        private void initSort()
        A private method to initialize the sorting operation.

        Tasks included:

        • initialising the data container c and putting data values into it,
        • instantiate the sortingAlg object depending on user's selection.

      • run

        public void run()
        A public run method being implemented for multi-threading.

        When invoked, it also calls the start of sorting operation. And every 10 milli-seconds it will check if there has been any terminate signal being sent by user. If yes, it will stop the sorting operation via Thread interruption.

        During the sorting, it will continously collect the current data container and pass it to drawChart() method of the SortVisualizer, such that the bar charts representing the sorting status can be drawn.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
        A public method to indicate the termination of sorting operation.

        It will set the terminate value to true, and invoke a call to terminate the sorting operation.

      • isCompleted

        public boolean isCompleted()
        A public method to indicate the completion of sorting operation.

        It will set the finish value to true.
